history.content:
Enrolling in Phase II for 61B is not a bad idea.

Almost everyone does get in in the end, at least in the previous semesters.

About the other classes, you're "allowed" to take a class as long as you get off the waitlist and honestly, considering your waitlist positions, your chances are pretty good.
How would you declare this semester if you're taking cs61b next semester?

children.subject: To initial student response: I've already taken the 61B equivalent at my CC so I don't need to take it at Berkeley. However, according to a major advisor, if I fail to declare with my grades in 61A and 70, I can take 61B for a letter grade to increase my declaration GPA.

history.content:
I'm a CS-intended transfer junior taking 61A and 70 (and 16A) to declare CS this semester. 

Currently I've enrolled in C100 and waitlisted on 170 @ position 114 and 188 @ position 134 and I haven't enrolled in 61B yet.

My plan if I don't declare this semester is to take: 61B, C100, and 170 or 188 (preferably 188). I haven't enrolled in 61B yet since I've heard there is usually enough space to enroll in phase 2.

If I do declare: I'll take C100, 170, 188.

Since I'm relatively new with enrolling in Berkeley classes, I was hoping for feedback here: Is my class enrollment strategy optimal? Will I likely be able to phase 2 61B? Even if I don't declare this semester, will I be allowed to take 170 or 188 next semester?
history.subject: Enrolling 61B/C100/170/188
